result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

with an additional $1000 signature bond. Conditions: Picture & prints, absolute sobriety, no contact with Co-Defendants Chad Lamberries and Jeffery Zeise directly or indirectly, no entry into Class B Establishments serving alcohol, no possession or use of illegal drugs, no possession or use of prescription drugs only with a valid prescription, no contact with any known drug users/sellers, no travel outside the State of Wisconsin without prior court approval.

1:28 PM Prosecuting attorney Joseph J. Kaupie in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant MALOREY C BORROUGHS appeared by video, in custody. Special appearance by Public Defender M. Kolell for bond purposes only. DE is eligible for PD Services. State recommends $1000 cash bond with conditions. Atty. Kolell request high signature bond. Court orders $500 cash bond with a $1000 signature bond and additional conditions. DE request to retrieve personal belongings from Co-Defendants residence. Court allows DE to retrieve items at a one-time basis with Law Enforcement present. Defendant would like the PH within 20 days.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 23, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
